definition: temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
to bestow a surname (of emperor conferring favor on ethnic group)
